intro: Adinandra zen-tasiroi, commonly known as the Tasiroi ironwood, is a rare and woody shrub native to the mountainous regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are clustered and produce small, white or pale yellow blooms, which attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Adinandra zen-tasiroi is considered a vulnerable species.
